org.spongepowered.api.item.recipe

Interface Recipe

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ShapedRecipe, ShapelessRecipe

    public interface Recipe

    A Recipe represents some craftable recipe in the game.

    It is essentially a Predicate that checks for if a recipe is valid as well as a function from a crafting matrix to a list of ItemStack (the crafting result), therefore making it an immutable interface.

    The passed in ItemGrid is usually a crafting inventory, e.g. a 2x2 or 3x3 crafting matrix.

    The requirements of a Recipe can be general, they just have to eventually return a boolean given an itemgrid.

    • Method Summary

      Returns the results for running this Recipe over an GridInventory
      java.util.List<ItemType> getResultTypes()
      Returns the list of item types that result when successful crafting of this Recipe is completed.
      boolean isValid(GridInventory grid)
      Checks if the given GridInventory fits the required constraints to craft this Recipe.

    • Method Detail

      • getResultTypes

        java.util.List<ItemType> getResultTypes()
        Returns the list of item types that result when successful crafting of this Recipe is completed.
        Returns:
        The resultant list of item types

      • isValid

        boolean isValid(GridInventory grid)
        Checks if the given GridInventory fits the required constraints to craft this Recipe.
        Parameters:
        grid - The ItemGrid to check for validity
        Returns:
        True if the given input matches this recipe's requirements

      • getResults

        com.google.common.base.Optional<java.util.List<ItemStack>> getResults(GridInventory grid)
        Returns the results for running this Recipe over an GridInventory
        Parameters:
        grid - An ItemGrid as input
        Returns:
        A list of ItemStacks or Optional.absent() if the given ItemGrid does not match this recipe's requirements.
